revised_title: Investigating Heat Conduction in Powders: A Hot Wire Method
tldr: This article presents a hot wire method to measure the conductivity of powders, focusing on heat conduction in gas-filled powders. The authors discovered that the conductivity of powders is related to the pressure and grain size, and they proposed a model to explain the observed behavior. The study provides insights into heat transfer processes in powders and has implications for various applications, such as materials science and engineering.
